articles.title: Floral basket and letter to Kim Jong Il
Ministry of Foreign Trade gives photo exhibition and film show
articles.content:
Floral basket and letter to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, June 18 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the diplomatic corps here on the occasion of the 35th anniversary of his beginning of work at the Central Committee of the Worker's Party of Korea.
   On behalf of the diplomatic corps Shaher Mohammed Abdlah, Palestinian Ambassador E. P. to Korea, handed the floral basket and the letter to DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun today.
   The Palestinian ambassador and the Syrian charge d'affaires ad interim here presented congratulatory letters respectively to Kim Jong Il. 
   The letters were handed  to officials concerned.

articles.title: S. Korean rulers' moves to destroy trade unions
articles.content:
Ministry of Foreign Trade gives photo exhibition and film show
    Pyongyang, June 18 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of Foreign Trade gave a photo exhibition and a film show on Thursday on the occasion of the 35th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's beginning of work at the Worker's Party of Korea central committee.
   Economic and trade officials of different embassies here were invited there.
   They looked round photos on the revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Il and saw a Korean documentary film.

articles.title: S. Korean war hawks' provocations to the north flailed
articles.content:
S. Korean rulers' moves to destroy trade unions
   Pyongyang, June 18 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea central committee issued a statement on Thursday to denounce the moves of the South Korean "prosecution" to destroy trade unions. 
   The statement said the recently disclosed plot of the "prosecution" to destroy trade unions is part of the planned fascist campaign of the authorities to arrest the South Korean worker's struggle for vital rights and democracy and stamp out the labour movement.   
   Pointing out that the South Korean rulers have harshly cracked down upon the worker's righteous struggle after branding it as "illegal one" and arrested trade union leaders by instructing "prosecution" to "induce" workers strikes in a cunning way in their bid to destroy trade unions and labour movement, it stressed:   The South Korean rulers should immediately dissolve the "prosecution," the "second intelligence service", and halt the fascist crackdown upon the labour movement.

articles.title: Russian National Day marked
35th anniv. of Kim Jong Il's start of work at C.C., WPK
articles.content:
Russian National Day marked
   Pyongyang, June 18 (KCNA) -- A film show was held here on Thursday on the occasion of the National Day of Russia.
   Invited there were Valery Denisov, Russian ambassador to Korea, and his embassy officials.
   Present there were Ri Song Ho, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and chairman of the Korea-Russia Friendship Association, officials concerned and working people. 
   The participants looked round photos introducing Russia and saw a Russian feature film.

articles.content:
GFTUK officials meet Bangladesh delegation
   Pyongyang, June 18 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held here on Thursday between officials of the central committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea (GFTUK) and members of the delegation of the Bangladesh National Union of Labour.    Among those present were Ri Jin Su, vice-chairman of the GFTUK central committee, its officials and members of the Bangladesh delegation led by general secretary  of the union Badal Khan.
   They conversed with each other, sharing friendship.

articles.content:
U.S. dispatches warships, aircraft on high alert
   Pyongyang, June 18 (KCNA) -- The command of the U.S. pacific fleet was reported on June 16 to have promptly dispatched aegis cruiser "Vincent" and several other modern warships to waters off the Korean peninsula "as regards the tense situation in the waters off the West Sea of Korea." 
   The command unveiled its decision to redeploy some of its military aircraft including electronic warfare planes.   
   In another development, the U.S. Defense Department announced that the carrier "constellation" belonging to the third U.S. fleet will be soon deployed in the waters near the Korean peninsula and that two wings of "F-18" fighters,  officers of the "patriot" command and 8 "F-16" fighters have been put on the alert to "cope with the emergency."
   The U.S. madcap arms build-up and heightened posture arouse deserved vigilance as they aggravate the tensions on the Korean peninsula.
